item.title: Concurrency
item.description: Concurrency Jobs can be configured to allow overlapping executions or forbid them. Concurrency property accepts two option: allow (default): Allow concurrent job executions. forbid: If the job is already running don’t send the execution, it will skip the executions until the next schedule. Example: { "name": "job1", "schedule": "@every 10s", "executor": "shell", "executor_config": { "command": "echo \"Hello from parent\"" }, "concurrency": "forbid" }

item.title: Cron spec
item.description: CRON Expression Format A cron expression represents a set of times, using 6 space-separated fields. Field name | Mandatory? | Allowed values | Allowed special characters ---------- | ---------- | -------------- | -------------------------- Seconds | Yes | 0-59 | * / , - Minutes | Yes | 0-59 | * / , - Hours | Yes | 0-23 | * / , - Day of month | Yes | 1-31 | * / , - ?

item.title: Job chaining
item.description: Job chaining You can set some jobs to run after other job is executed. To setup a job that will be executed after any other given job, just set the parent_job property when saving the new job. The dependent job will be executed after the main job finished a successful execution. Child jobs schedule property will be ignored if it’s present. Take into account that parent jobs must be created before any child job.

item.title: Job retries
item.description: Jobs can be configured to retry in case of failure. Configuration { "name": "job1", "schedule": "@every 10s", "executor": "shell", "executor_config": { "command": "echo \"Hello from parent\"" }, "retries": 5 } In case of failure to run the job in one node, it will try to run the job again in that node until the retries count reaches the limit.

item.title: Metrics
item.description: Dkron has the ability to send metrics to Statsd for dashboards and historical reporting. It sends job processing metrics and golang, serf metrics too. item.title: Use with AWS ECS
item.description: Use with Amazon ECS To use Dkron to schedule jobs that run in containers, a wrapper ECS script is needed. Install the following snippet in the node that will run the call to ECS Prerequisites The node that will run the call to ECS will need to have installed AWS cli jq Example ecs-run --cluster cron --task-definition cron-taskdef --container-name cron --region us-east-1 --command "rake foo"
